definition[0]: used to add to a negative statement, to disagree with a negative statement by someone else, or to answer no to a question
example[0]: It wasn’t a good thing; on the contrary it was a huge mistake.
example[1]: ‘I suppose your wife doesn’t understand you.’ ‘On the contrary, she understands me very well.’
example[2]: ‘Are they happy?’ ‘No, no, quite the contrary.’
